section.title: Introduction
section.para: This chapter covers the work environment setup for building red5 and the tools you will need.

section.title: Ant
section.para: Apache Ant 1.7 and above is required for building the Red5 project source code.
The path to the ant binary must be on your system PATH environment variable (test by typing ant -version at a system prompt) defined, typically
You can check this on windows by typing set PATH or on unix by typing echo $PATH

section.title: Java
section.para: Java 1.5 or 1.6 and above is required for running ant, compiling the source and running the Red5 server.
You must have the environment variables for JAVA_HOME and JAVA_VERSION defined, typically
JAVA_HOME=C:\development\j2sdk\1.5.0_07 JAVA_VERSION=1.5 You can check this on windows by typing set JAVA_HOME or on unix by typing echo $JAVA_HOME

caution.para: FAILURE TO SETUP YOUR ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES WILL PREVENT YOUR FROM BEING ABLE TO BUILD PROPERLY

note.para: You don't need netbeans or eclipse unless you need an IDE for java.
